Class ExcelWriterUtil

java.lang.Object
fileUtil.ExcelWriterUtil
public class ExcelWriterUtil extends Object
This class is used to write data to an Excel file. It provides methods to set the sheet, create rows and cells, and write values to cells. It also provides a method to flush the changes to the file.
Since:
2025-06-01
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ravi Shankar

  • Constructor Details

    • ExcelWriterUtil

      public ExcelWriterUtil(String path)
      Constructor to initialize the ExcelWriterUtil with the path of the Excel file. It opens the file and creates a Workbook instance.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the Excel file to be written to.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be opened or is encrypted.

  • Method Details

    • setSheet

      public org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet setSheet(Object sheetValue)
      Sets the sheet to be used for writing data. The sheet can be specified by its index (Integer) or by its name (String).
      Parameters:
      sheetValue - The index or name of the sheet to be set.
      Returns:
      The Sheet instance that has been set.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the workbook is not initialized or has no sheets.
      IllegalArgumentException - if an unexpected type is provided.

    • createSheet

      public org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet createSheet(String name)
      Creates a new sheet with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new sheet to be created.
      Returns:
      The newly created Sheet instance.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the workbook is not initialized or has no sheets.

    • getRow

      public org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row getRow(int i)
      Retrieves a row from the current sheet by its index.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the row to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The Row instance at the specified index.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the workbook is not initialized, has no sheets, or if the row is not initialized.

    • createRow

      public org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row createRow(int i)
      Creates a new row at the specified index in the current sheet.
      Parameters:
      i - The index at which the new row should be created.
      Returns:
      The newly created Row instance.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the workbook is not initialized, has no sheets, or if the row is not initialized.

    • createCell

      public org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Cell createCell(int i)
      Creates a new cell at the specified index in the current row.
      Parameters:
      i - The index at which the new cell should be created.
      Returns:
      The newly created Cell instance.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the workbook is not initialized, has no sheets, or if the row or cell is not initialized.

    • cellValue

      public void cellValue(Object value)
      Sets the value of the current cell to the specified value. The value can be of type Integer, String, Double, or Long.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to be set in the cell.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the workbook is not initialized, has no sheets, or if the row or cell is not initialized.
      IllegalArgumentException - if an unexpected type is provided.

    • flush

      public void flush()
      Flushes the changes made to the workbook to the specified file path. It writes the workbook to the file and closes the resources.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the workbook is not initialized, has no sheets, or if the row or cell is not initialized.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the file path is invalid or cannot be written to.
